prompt.content: The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about job.

Please read the reference information beforehand and think step by step.
[Reference Information]
Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

[Question] Choose the most accurate paraphrase of "ヘルパー（有資格）" from the options below.

A. 介護職
B. 介護職（有資格）
C. 介護職（無資格）
D. 介護職／正社員
E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:

data.sampled: Option G is the correct answer. The original phrase, "ケアスタッフ (None Qualified)," can be translated to English as "Caregiver with No Qualifications". While there may be other job titles that use this same terminology in Japan, Option G accurately conveys the meaning of the original phrase.

data.sampled:
A. 介護職は、介助を行うことで、一人の世帯が日々の生活に適した配慮と専門的な知恵を提供することができる。 また、介護時間は、家族やその他の共同調理者からの熟練な指導を受けて定められ、丁寧に執行されます。 介護職には、多くの種類があり、これらはすべて、特別な心理学の試験において証明された特徴を備えています。 

B. 介護の仕事ですよ! 何でもできちゃいますよ!!!!! どこでも始めればOKですし! (I'm in the business of taking care of things. Anything can be done with enough hard work!)  

C. 介護をしているなんですか？ 私は介護をしてません (How do you take care of things? I don't.)   

D. 介護なんだって？ あんたのお父さん、介護じゃないよ! (Why do we need care? Your father isn't one for it!)  

E. 介護は仲間と共感を深めるのです (Care helps us grow together).  

F. 働きたいです 介護が好きです (I want to work, but I like taking care of people too).    

G. 介護なんです

prompt.content: The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about job.

Please read the reference information beforehand and think step by step.
[Reference Information]
Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

data.sampled:
A. 介護職
This accurately captures the meaning of "caregiver," which refers specifically to individuals who provide support and assistance to those in need. The word does not include any qualifications or experience requirements, so it can be used to refer to anyone who provides such services.
